thread.title: Outdoors: Calendar, Oct. 23-Nov. 6
thread.title_full: Outdoors: Calendar, Oct. 23-Nov. 6 - San Antonio Express-News

author: John Goodspeed
title: Outdoors: Calendar, Oct. 23-Nov. 6
text:
Saturday
Guadalupe River State Park: Bird Walk and Talk Along the River, with park host interpreter Laura Paulson , 8:30-11 a.m. For ages 10 and older. Binoculars available. Meet at Discovery Center. Free. Entrance fees apply. Call 830-438-7653.
Guadalupe River State Park: Stories in the Stars with presentation and viewing through telescopes hosted by the San Antonio Astronomical Association , 7:30-9:30 p.m. Meet at the amphitheater. Free. Entrance fees apply. Call 830-438-7653.
Palmetto State Park: Fishing with a Ranger, a program for beginners outlining the basics, 10-11 a.m. Some loaner poles and tackle available. Bring your own bait. Free with park admission. Call 830-672-3266 or click on tpwd.texas.gov.
Garner State Park: Autumn Celebration welcoming cooler weather and Halloween with pumpkin carving (bring your own), carnival games, spooky tales and campfire treats, 6-8:30 p.m., CCC Pavilion. Free. Admission fees apply. Call 830-232-6132, Ext. 236.
Guadalupe River Chapter of Trout Unlimited: Meeting, 9 a.m., Canyon Lake Community Resource and Recreation Center, Sattler. Presentation at 11 by Spencer Seim on fly fishing in New Mexico. Call Scott Thompson , 830-931-3900, or visit grtu.org.
Sunday
Guadalupe River State Park: 11th annual Halloween at the Park for families with children ages 2-12, 6-8:30 p.m. Storytelling, lighted trail walk, decorations, hot dogs and drinks. $10 per vehicle in addition to entrance fees. Call 830-438-7653.
Tuesday
Texas Outdoors Woman Network of San Antonio: Monthly meeting with a special presentation, 6 p.m., Lion & Rose, 842 N.W. Loop 410. Nonmembers welcome. For more information, click on townsa.org.
New Braunfels Fly Fishers: Monthly meeting with guest speaker, 7 p.m., McKenna Event Center , 801 W. San Antonio St., New Braunfels. Nonmembers welcome. Call Jay Rogers , 830-837-3022. or click on newbraunfelsflyfishers.org.
Oct. 31
Guadalupe River State Park: Fishing 101, basics for children and beginners including fishing for sunfish, bass and catfish, 9-11 a.m. Bait and loaner rods and reels available. Free. Entrance fees apply. RSVP at craig.hensley@tpwd.texas.gov .
Guadalupe River State Park: Halloween Night Hike, 7:30-9 p.m. Costumes encouraged for walk in search of owls, bats and more. Meet at amphitheater. Free. Entrance fees apply. RSVP at craig.hensley@tpwd.texas.gov
Nov. 1
Texas Freshwater Fishing Hall of Fame: Deadline for nominations of individuals or organizations that have made a lasting contribution to freshwater fishing in Texas. Click tpwd.texas.gov and search for hall of fame.
Nov. 6
Bandera County Convention and Visitors Bureau : 53rd annual Hunters Bar-B-Que & MusicFest, 3:30-10:30 p.m., Cattleman’s Barn at Antler Oaks Lodge. Outdoor gear vendors, auction, gun raffle. Almost Patsy Cline Band, 3:30 p.m.; Chris Saucedo , 8 p.m. $25, includes barbecue plate. Special music and events at area dance halls. Click on banderahuntersbbq.com.
Uvalde Chamber of Commerce: 34th annual Hunters’ Roundup, 5 p.m.-midnight, Uvalde County Fairplex. Music, vendor booths, exhibits, food, gun raffle. Click on uvalde.org or call 830-278-3361.
Llano Chamber of Commerce: Hunter Appreciation Day, 9 a.m.-3 p.m., 100 Train Station Drive, Llano. Free goody bags, food, drinks, vendor and hunting guide booths, firearm raffle. Click on llanochamber.org or call 325-247-5354.
Have an item for the Outdoor Calendar? Email John Goodspeed at john@johngoodspeed.com .
